docs.lead_paragraph: 8 P.M. (Showtime) TWILIGHT (2008) Kristen Stewart (right, with Robert Pattinson) is Bella Swan, the new girl in a small Washington town who falls, body and soul, for Edward Cullen (Mr. Pattinson), a vampire with all sorts of superhuman powers -- but who somehow manages to keep his fangs in his mouth. Catherine Hardwicke directed this unorthodox romance, based on the novel by Stephenie Meyer and a script by Melissa Rosenberg. Peter Facinelli assumes a ghostly pallor as Carlisle, Edward's doctor father and the head of a picture-pretty, well-behaved clan (played by Ashley Greene, Nikki Reed, Jackson Rathbone and Kellan Lutz) that, but for occasional hunting sprees, likes to think of itself as, uh, vegetarian. Manohla Dargis, writing in The New York Times, called the film ''a deeply sincere, outright goofy vampire romance for the hot-not-to-trot abstinence set.'' 10:30 A.M. (13) RELIGION & ETHICS NEWSWEEKLY Kim Lawton reports on the aftermath of the earthquake in Haiti and humanitarian aid efforts. Fred de Sam Lazaro looks at the impact of India's fast-growing economy on the practice of traditional Hinduism.
